answerText: functional programming languages[10] This ubiquitous higher-order function repeatedly applies a function to successive elements of a recursive data structure and accumulates the results. As every category theoretician knows, this function is a catamorphism.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | WUSTL-Columbia B-Berkeley A  | 20 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this type of language. These languages make extensive use of "higher-order" forms of their namesake constructs.
